intro: Mitscherlichia spectabilis, commonly known as the showy mitscherlichia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
